metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15652 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Artifex Ghostscript 9.22 is affected by: Obtain Information. The impact is:obtain sensitive information. The component is: affected source code file,affected function, affected executable, affected libga (imagemagick usedthat). The attack vector is: Someone must open a postscript file thoughghostscript. Because of imagemagick also use libga, so it was affected aswell.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15652` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.9
ghostscript-x - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.9
libgs9 - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.9
libgs9-common - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.9').
